channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Week: Musk’s DOGE Takes On Washington
item.description: Plus: Donald Trump considers a real-estate opportunity in Gaza.

item.title: Trump Signals He’ll Fight For Reality At UNICEF With Motion To Nuke DEI And Trans Ideology
item.description: Though the trans- and DEI-focused amendments failed to pass, they demonstrated that the Trump administration intends to fight on all fronts.

item.title: Transgender people sue Trump administration over new passport policy eliminating 'X' gender marker
item.description: A group of transgender individuals is suing the Trump administration over a new policy that eliminates the "X" gender marker on passports.

item.title: Fox News Politics Newsletter: Drill, baby, drill!
item.description: Welcome to the Fox News Politics newsletter, with the latest updates on the Trump administration, exclusive interviews and more Fox News politics cont...

item.title: Two Cheers for Tariffs
item.description: Not every tariff is a boon, nor is every one a bane. But they can provide long-term gains well in excess of their short-term costs.

item.title: Sanders and Hawley’s Interest Rate Cap Would Ban Their Union Allies’ Credit Cards
item.description: They want to cap interest rates at 10 percent, but most major unions’ member benefits include credit cards that charge well in excess of that.

item.title: Hegseth to look into 'what went wrong' in Afghanistan and pledges accountability, slams diversity motto
item.description: While speaking to the DoD, Secretary Pete Hegseth promised accountability for Afghanistan events.

item.title: Watchdog To DOJ: Investigate Oregon For Destroying Voter Records
item.description: The Civil Rights Act of 1960 requires election officials to 'retain and preserve' voter roll maintenance documents for 22 months and produce them 'upo...

item.title: Trump signs executive order creating White House Faith Office again
item.description: President Trump has signed an executive order establishing the White House Faith Office, an office he had during his first term.

item.title: Indiana District Approves Pornographic Book In Class, Bans Requirement For Parental Consent
item.description: The school board denied a motion to require parental consent for children to access the book and approved another to keep the title on library shelves...

item.title: Trump freezes aid to South Africa
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order Friday freezing aid to South Africa over a "shocking disregard of its citizens' rights."

item.title: Democratic AGs from 19 states sue Trump admin over DOGE access to sensitive, personal data at Treasury
item.description: A federal lawsuit filed by 19 Democratic state attorneys general claims Elon Musk's DOGE violated the law by accessing American's personal data from t...

item.title: Attention Must Be Paid: The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act Is Set to Expire
item.description: Expiring provisions promise tax hikes if not extended.

item.title: In Defense of Ben Sasse
item.description: Tentative audit findings fail to back up the barrage of media attacks the former university president and senator has faced over expenses.

item.title: Trump freezes aid to South Africa, promotes resettlement of refugees facing race discrimination
item.description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order freezing all aid to South Africa and pledging to promote resettlement of refugees facing race discrim...

item.title: Trump says he will name himself Kennedy Center board chair and impose programming changes
item.description: President Trump announced Friday night that he plans to name himself chairman of the Kennedy Center Board and use the post to dictate programming at o...

item.title: NCAA Had The Power To Keep Men Out Of Women’s Sports This Whole Time
item.description: It's about time we have a president who is actually listening to the everyday victims of men in ladyface.

item.title: Trump says he revoked Biden's security clearance
item.description: President Trump said late Friday that he would bar his predecessor, President Biden, from receiving intelligence briefings traditionally given to form...

item.title: Trump appoints himself as chairman of the Kennedy Center, firing board members
item.description: President Trump said Friday that he is appointing himself chairman of Washington's Kennedy Center for the performing arts to make it "great again" and...

item.title: USAID Funneled Nearly $800 Million To ‘Gender Transformative’ Global Censorship Group
item.description: USAID funneled $799 million to a group that launched a global censorship platform and pushed radical gender ideology.
